      Add the specified channel to the job.

      Add the specified channel to the job.

      Adds the provided SurfaceScatterer specimen to the job.

      Adds the provided SurfaceScatterer specimen to the job.

      Adds the provided SurfaceScatterer specimens to the job.

      Adds the specified wavelength to the job.

      Adds the specified wavelengths to the job.

      Adds the specified wavelengths to the job.
      TransferMatrixJob.Builder TransferMatrixJob.Builder.setAdjoint(boolean adjoint)
      Sets a value indicating whether to trace rays in the reverse direction (i.e., from the eye direction).
      TransferMatrixJob.Builder TransferMatrixJob.Builder.setCollectorSphere(CollectorSphere collector)
      Sets the CollectorSphere to use for both the incident and exitant vectors.
      TransferMatrixJob.Builder TransferMatrixJob.Builder.setExitantCollectorSphere(CollectorSphere exitantCollector)
      Sets the CollectorSphere to use for the exitant directions.
      TransferMatrixJob.Builder TransferMatrixJob.Builder.setExitantVectorStrategy(TransferMatrixJob.ExitantVectorStrategy exitantVectorStrategy)
      Sets the exitant vector parameterization to use.
      TransferMatrixJob.Builder TransferMatrixJob.Builder.setIncidentCollectorSphere(CollectorSphere incidentCollector)
      Sets the CollectorSphere to use for the incident directions.
      TransferMatrixJob.Builder TransferMatrixJob.Builder.setIncidentPointsOutward(boolean incidentPointsOutward)
      Sets a value indicating whether the incident vector points outward
      TransferMatrixJob.Builder TransferMatrixJob.Builder.setSamplesPerMeasurement(long samplesPerMeasurement)
      Sets the number of samples to use for each measurement (i.e., for each specimen/wavelength pair).
      TransferMatrixJob.Builder TransferMatrixJob.Builder.setSamplesPerTask(long samplesPerTask)
      Sets the number of samples to use for each task.
      TransferMatrixJob.Builder TransferMatrixJob.Builder.setTasksPerMeasurement(long tasksPerMeasurement)
      Sets the number of samples to use for each task to target the specified number of tasks per measurement.
